creator: vikramkashyap
title: Dragon Curve Using Python
description: This project provides instructions on how to write a Python 3 program using the turtle graphics module to generate the Dragon Curve, a self-similar fractal. The program takes user inputs for iteration, segment length, and colors to customize the dragon curve drawing.
steps: Define variables 'r' and 'l' to represent right and left turns.
Initialize 'old' and 'new' variables to 'r', representing the first iteration.
Get user input for the desired iteration, segment length, pen color, and background color.
Start a 'while' loop that continues as long as the cycle is less than the desired iteration.
Inside the loop: Add 'r' to the end of the 'old' string and save it to 'new'.
Reverse the 'old' string using string slicing.
Iterate through each character in the reversed 'old' string, replacing 'r' with 'l' and 'l' with 'r'.
Append the reversed and switched 'old' string to the 'new' string.
After the loop, ask the user if they want to display the r/l form of the dragon curve.
Set up the turtle graphics window by hiding the turtle, setting the speed, and applying the user-requested colors.
Move the turtle forward by the segment length to draw the first line.
Iterate through the 'new' string (the final iteration).
For each character in the string, turn the turtle right 90 degrees if it's 'r', or left 90 degrees if it's 'l'.
After each turn, move the turtle forward by the segment length.
